resources.string: Are you sure to delete this entry? This cannot be undone.
Are you sure to discard changes?

Thank you for using AppManager! AppManager is a alpha/beta version app's downloader/installer.


If you have received emails with URL and have been told to use this app, tap the link and open with this app. If you don't have received any emails, tap "Add new app" button and fill in the forms.


Then, tap "Download" button to download and install the app. If the app properly downloaded, a dialog will open that ask you to install the app.


If you don't allow installing app outside the Google Play, you cannot install apps. If you fail to install apps, open the device's settings screen, check "Unknown sources" to allow installing apps other than Google Play. "Unknown sources" setting is included "Security" category or something like that. It might be different depending on the OS version or device models.

Thank you for using AppManager! AppManager is a alpha/beta app downloader and installer. 
To distribute apps for testers, at first, locate your APK file to your server.


And the testers must install this app. Note that "Unknown sources" must be enabled to install alpha/beta apps using this app.


Then you tell the testers the information to install the app: URL for the APK file, basic auth user/password if needed.


These information can be included in some kind of URL, which launch this apps by Intent. 
For example, if you locate the APK file to 
http://example.com/path/to/awsomeapp.apk 
set basic auth with user name "user" and password "pass", and app name "GreatApp", you can write the URL like this: 

http://user:pass@import-to-appmanager/example.com/path/to/awesomeapp.apk#GreatApp 

or you can use the following hostname: 

http://user:pass@app-manager.github.io/example.com/path/to/awesomeapp.apk#GreatApp
